Sentencas: NiO-yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) hollow fibres with varying NiO content and a desired microstructure were prepared using a phase inversion technique and sintering.
Titulo: Characterization of NiO-yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) hollow fibres for use as SOFC anodes

Sentencas: By controlling the fabrication parameters, microstructures with predominately finger-like pores near the inner and outer surfaces and a denser central layer with sponge-like pores were produced, for use as substrates for anode-supported hollow fibre solid oxide fuel cells (HF-SOFC).
Titulo: Characterization of NiO-yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) hollow fibres for use as SOFC anodes

Sentencas: The NiO-YSZ fibres were reduced to Ni-YSZ at 250-700 degrees C in hydrogen flowing at 20 cm(3) min(-1) to produce Ni-YSZ hollow fibres, the mechanical and electrical properties of which were determined subsequently, reduction to Ni being verified by X-ray diffraction.
Titulo: Characterization of NiO-yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) hollow fibres for use as SOFC anodes

Sentencas: The effects of NiO concentration and sintering temperature of the fibre precursors on the conductivity, strength and porosity of the reduced hollow fibres were investigated to assess their suitability for use as anode substrates.
Titulo: Characterization of NiO-yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) hollow fibres for use as SOFC anodes

Sentencas: As expected, increasing Ni concentration increased electrical conductivities and decreased mechanical strength.
Titulo: Characterization of NiO-yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) hollow fibres for use as SOFC anodes

Sentencas: Sintering temperature had a critical effect in producing axially conductive hollow fibres of sufficient mechanical strength for use as SOFC anodes.
Titulo: Characterization of NiO-yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) hollow fibres for use as SOFC anodes
